events.title: First Impressionist Exhibition Opens in Paris
events.description: The first independent exhibition by the Impressionists opened in Paris, showcasing works by artists including Monet, Degas, and Renoir.
events.significance: This exhibition marked a major shift in art history, challenging traditional styles and leading to the recognition of Impressionism as a major art movement.

events.title: Soviet Union Invades Finland Starting the Winter War
events.description: The Soviet Union launched an invasion of Finland, initiating the Winter War, after Finland refused demands for territorial concessions.
events.significance: The Winter War exposed the vulnerabilities of the Soviet military and gained international sympathy for Finland.

events.title: The U.S. Senate Votes to Censure Senator Joseph McCarthy
events.description: The United States Senate formally censured Senator Joseph McCarthy for conduct unbecoming a senator related to his anti-communist investigations.
events.significance: This event marked the decline of McCarthy's influence and a turning point against the Red Scare in the United States.

events.title: Toy Story Released in Theaters
events.description: Pixar's 'Toy Story,' the first fully computer-animated feature film, was released.
events.significance: Toy Story revolutionized animation and established CGI as a dominant technology in filmmaking.

events.title: The Mumbai Terror Attacks End
events.description: The 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, which lasted for four days, officially ended on November 30, with security forces regaining control of the city.
events.significance: These attacks resulted in significant loss of life and led to global discussions on counter-terrorism measures.
